content.title: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia Type 2 (ACVRL1)
content.description: HHT Type 2 caused by mutations in the ACVRL1 gene encoding ALK1

key_concepts.details: Autosomal dominant mutations in ACVRL1 gene encoding activin receptor-like kinase 1 (ALK1)
Higher prevalence of hepatic AVMs compared to HHT Type 1
Later onset of symptoms, mucocutaneous telangiectasias, hepatic vascular malformations
Lower prevalence of pulmonary AVMs (approximately 20-30%) compared to Type 1

content.clinical_significance: HHT Type 2 requires hepatic screening and monitoring for high-output cardiac failure

primary_sources: Faughnan ME et al. J Med Genet 2011
